result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John McMahon Shipp

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for John McMahon Shipp
Current: 531 E Tomlinson Street, Poynette, WI 53955 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2016)
Prior: 531 E Tomlinson Street, Poynette, WI 53955

Cases called: 14CT352, 14CT353, 14FO793, 15CF78, 15CF122, 15CF123, 15CF199, 15CT27, 15CF424, 15TR3178, 15TR3179, 15TR3180, 15TR3181, Defendant John McMahon Shipp in court with attorney Ryan T. Frank.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to counts 4,5,6 in 15CF122, counts 6,7,8 in 15CF199 and count 1 in 15CT27.
Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence on 15CT27: 37 days jail starting Jan. 4, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $1,568 fine, 60 days or payment plan. $65 blood draw fee. 16 mo. driver license revocation, 16 mo. IID. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations. (no jail credit). In 15CF199, 9 months jail on ct. 6, Consecutive to 15CT27. Huber granted under jail rules. Electronic monitoring granted. $443 costs. On cts. 7&8, 3 yr. probation. Absolute sobriety at all times. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations.  $243 costs on each count. DNA sample be submitted. (3 days jail credit on count 5). In 15CF122, 3 years probation on each count, $443, $243, $243 costs. Complete AODA and follow treatment recommendations. Absolute sobriety at all times. DNA sample be submitted. (1 day jail credit) 
All other criminal counts and cases read in and dismissed. Traffic and ordinance cases dismissed.
from S.S. requesting bond amendment, State objecting to request

standard felony conditions, no contact w/S.S., not to be on premises of bars/taverns where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption, not possess any controlled substances or paraphernalia w/out prescription, may return to residence one time w/law enforcement to obtain belongings, absolute sobriety,

Defendant John McMahon Shipp in court, in custody by video with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives time limits to prelim, right to atty recited, $1,500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/S.S., not to be on premises of bars/taverns, where alcohol is sold for onsight consumption, not possess any controlled substances or paraphernalia w/out prescription, may return to residence one time w/law enforcement to obtain belongings, absolute sobriety, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 10:10 am.  Return date scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
